page.title: 02MEDIAEVAL MARKET TOWN
page.content: The Monks of Bec in Normandy during the 11th century were offered the manor or estate of Atherstone by Hugh,Earl of Chester.The Monks of Bec used the revenue to support their Abbey in Normandy.In 1289 burgage tenements were set around the market area and along the Watling Street in an attempt to establish a market town with borough status.In1294 there were 36 free tenants in the manor.A twice weekly market was granted to the town and also an annual fair.However the town failed to thrive and never achieved borough status. At the end of the 14C the land was given to the Augustinian preaching friars who built a chapel which was in regular use for worship until the dissolution of the monasteries in the 16th Century. .
